text: Yes thank you, i also just found out that this internal value is actually the owner id!

Hi everyone! Does anyone know if it is possible to get a simple table like this through an API?

Column 1: Deal ID
Column 2: Deal Stage
Column 3: Date of Stage Change

Hi, guys update api is not given for contact timeline event

So , i think that i will update like this

GET and store previous dtls ,
DELETE
CREATE the event with updated dtls .

But DELETE api is not there for contact timeline event

So how will i update the event then inside contact timeline

Also ,
I am using contact timeline api to send different event to HubSpot ,
and its succesfully adding , but can anyone let me know where i can see all this list of events i have send ,
i am only able to make segment over it but not able to see all the event i have send ?

is there any dashboard or page for the same ?

You cannot delete event data which is by design.

In your example 2 events should be sent - one for a user starting to fill out the form and one for a user to actually submitting the form

Hi, when creating a task - I also want to set the due date and set up an email reminder. Based on the documentation. It doesn't seem to be available? <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/tasks> Anyone who has done this?

Hello everyone

I have a query related to this API <https://api.hubapi.com/files/v3/files>.I got the error "MISSING_SCOPES" while using this API <https://api.hubapi.com/files/v3/files>.I checked the Auth token scope with this <https://api.hubapi.com/oauth/v1/access-tokens/{token}> and got the below response

{

    "token": "CP6Z-_xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxVZL7XtKA25hMVIAWgA",

    "user": "<mailto:akshay.dobariya@ajmerainfotech.com|x>xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx",

    "hub_domain": "<http://app.com|app.com>",

    "scopes": [

        "oauth",

        "files",

        "tickets",

        "files.ui_hidden.read"

    ],

    "hub_id": xxxx,

    "app_id": xxx,

    "expires_in": 1166,

    "user_id": xxxxxxxxxxxx,

    "token_type": "access"

}

Is this a private app within your portal or a public app?

If public, make sure your token was generated after the scope was added. To ensure this, use the refresh token and the ln use the access_token and see if you get the same error
